alert.note: Alert for Bexar (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 8:42AM CDT until May 15 at 3:21AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... San Antonio River Near Elmendorf affecting Wilson and Bexar Counties. Cibolo Creek Near Falls City affecting Karnes County. San Antonio River near Floresville affecting Karnes and Wilson Counties. Medina River At Hwy 281 affecting Bexar County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Medina River At Hwy 281. * WHEN...From this evening to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding floods secondary roads and bridges making them dangerous to traffic. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 6.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening before cresting at 22.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.8 feet on 10/14/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Medina River Hwy 281 20.0 6.2 Sat 6 am CDT 22.1 17.2 9.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 845 PM CDT.
